result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Leah Spangler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony, Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Heather Leah Spangler, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Timothy J Burns.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant pleads no contest, sentenced to 2 years probation. Concurrent with any other sentence. to pay restitution of $1,594.96 to Walmart (with co-defendant) as a condition of probation. Also to pay costs of supervision and treatment, and to undergo alcohol and drug counseling and treatment as conditions of probation.

Heather Leah Spangler, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy M. Taylor. Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Mr Taylor informs the Court that Ms Spangler was unable to attend last court date due to being incarcerrated in the Dane County Jail. Mr Taylor also informs the Court that Ms Spangler qualified for a State Public Defender in this case. Court reinstates bond and recalls bench warrant. Warrant was never issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
